snippet: The link between obesity and poverty is close and complicated, as leaders in one city learned when they tried to make high-calorie beverages more expensive.
abstract: Richmond journal; proposed one-cent-per-ounce tax on sugar-sweetened beverages sold in Richmond, Calif, which has double the national poverty rate, is the most visible West Coast municipal challenge yet to soda; tax money would go toward fighting childhood obesity; tax proposal, to appear on the November ballot, is being viewed as a beachhead by a coalition of beverage makers, merchant groups and labor unions who are organizing to defeat it.
lead_paragraph: The link between obesity and poverty is close and complicated, as leaders in one city learned when they tried to make high-calorie beverages more expensive.

headline.seo: Richmond, Calif., Seeks to Tax Sweetened Beverages
headline.main: Plan to Tax Soda Gets a Mixed Reception
headline.print_headline: Plan to Tax Soda Gets a Mixed Reception
